title: Verb patterns: gerund or infinitive - 2
instructions: Complete the sentences with the verbs. Use the B1gerundB2 or the B1to-infinitiveB2.

explain: Corr: to walk. After 'want' we always use the to-infinitive.
Corr: listening. After 'enjoy' we always use the gerund.
Corr: to open. After 'decide' we always use the to-infinitive.
Corr: learning. After 'stop' we use the gerund if the gerund is the object of 'stop', so it means to give up doing something.
Corr: to make. We use the to-infinitive after 'would like'. If it's only 'like', we can use both the gerund and the infinitive.
Corr: to finish. After 'manage' we use the to-infinitive.
Corr: doing. After 'finish' we use the gerund.
